VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_sTree Struct Reference

#include <VLIB_haarDetectObjects_types.h>

Collaboration diagram for VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_sTree:

[legend]

Detailed Description

This structure holds property of one tree. Each tree has maximum VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_MAX_NODE_PER_TREE (3) number of nodes and each node can have maximum VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_MAX_RECT_PER_NODE (3) rectangles. Each rectangle is associated with weight to it. Each node will have a threshold (referred as alpha here) to compare with. There are VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_MAX_NODE_PER_TREE (3) number of conditions checks in a tree and the bit packed result of these condition checks can be used to select one of the tree score from 'result[]'. It might be required to put some duplicate elements in 'results' to have desire result for each bit packed index.

Parameters:
weight All possible rectangles weights. Each element is signed 8 bit quantity for each rectangle. If a rectangle is not present then make the 8 bit weight corresponding to that rectangle as 0. '-1' weight is represented by 0xFF.
numNodes Number of nodes in given tree.
rect All possible rectangle offset in a node - 3 (Rect/Node) * 3 (Node/Tree)
alpha Threshold to be compared with evaluated feature in each node.
result Tree result for various combination of outcome of nodes feature comparisions
Lets assume that feature for each node is termed as FR1, FR2 and FR3 Threshold for respective node is alpha1, alpha2, alpha3 and flag1 = FR1 > alpha1, flag2 = FR2 > alpha2, flag3 = FR3 > alpha3 form a index = ((flag3 << 2) | (flag2 << 1) | (flag1)) Now this index if used in 'result' array of 8 values then it should give proper value. All this is off-line computed and 'result' array is populated. From above logic - below table can be formed, as for three node tree there are four possible value for tree score lets say these scores are R0,R1,R2,R3. Same logic can be extended for any number of nodes in tree.

flag3 flag2 flag1 Result 0 0 0 R3 0 0 1 R0 0 1 0 R1 0 1 1 R0 1 0 0 R2 1 0 1 R0 1 1 0 R1 1 1 1 R0

Parameters:
rectType Rectangle type for each rectangle in tree. Refer VLIB_HAARDETOBJ_rectType
